chapter.title: How Application Registration Works
chapter.para: To access &COMPANYABBR; data, applications, and services, applications must meet the following requirements:

listitem.para: Must be authorized for use by each education organization that wants to use that application

chapter.para: You can ensure an application meets these requirements by following the &COMPANYABBR;'s application registration process. This is a one-time process that establishes a trusted relationship between the application and a given &COMPANYABBR; deployment.
Your part in the application process will vary based on your role in &COMPANYABBR;:

listitem.para: As an &COMPANYABBR; user, you can only access applications that have been through this registration process. Available applications are listed in &COMPANYABBR;.
If you're a developer, you must register your application with &COMPANYABBR;, then authorize its use by given education organizations.
If you are an &PRODUCTABBR; administrator, you can approve and manage the applications in the &PRODUCTABBR; Production environment you're administering.

chapter.para: The registration process also varies based on the type of application you're registering. Look for references to each of these application types as you step through the registration procedure:

listitem.para: A web application resides on servers accessible over a network connection. A user can interact with a web application through a web browser installed on desktop, laptop, or mobile device, without installing any part of the application on that device.

Installed applications are those that are installed on a personal device in which the user (1) is driving the application and (2) has access to a web browser on the same device. This would include, but is not limited to, applications designed for Apple iOS, Android, and desktop operating systems like Microsoft Windows.
